intro: Iris tricuspidata, commonly known as the three-lobed iris, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers with three prominent lobes. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring sword-shaped leaves that are dark green and often hairy. Its rhizomatous root system allows it to thrive in well-drained, moist soils. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, making it a notable ornamental plant in gardens and natural habitats.
